articles.title: Kim Jong Il has unofficial meeting with V.V. Putin
Highly reputed circus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il has unofficial meeting with V.V. Putin 
    Moscow, August 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, had an unofficial meeting with Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, President of the Russian Federation, today upon the conclusion of his stay in Moscow.
 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks to V.V. Putin for the special hospitality accorded to him during his visit and had a cordial and friendly talk with Putin.

articles.title: South Korean students on hunger strike before White House
Anti-Ri Hoe Chang struggle called for
articles.content:
South Korean students on hunger strike before White House 
    pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Students under the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils and the south headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly went on a hunger strike in front of the White House in Washington on August 6, demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. hard-line policy towards the DPRK and pullout of the U.S. troops from South Korea, etc.
 Representatives of the organizations Tuesday called a press conference at which they said they would continue their hunger strike until August 20.    
 And they declared that they decided to address an open letter carrying their demand to bush and sent a letter to the U.S. ambassador to South Korea demanding a reply to the letter and an interview.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
Japanese chief executive's moves to revive militarism condemned
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Swiss Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Martin Lotscher, chairman of the committee, on a visit to the DPRK.
